title: Japanese-Style Ginger Salad Dressing Recipe
description: This ginger salad dressing comes together in minutes for the perfect combination of sweet, salty, and umami flavors. Try it over any green salad!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Salad Dressing Recipes Japanese-Style Ginger Salad Dressing 4.2 (171) 138 Reviews 6 Photos This ginger salad dressing tastes just like the kind they serve in Japanese steakhouses. Submitted by Paula Updated on November 15, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 5 mins Total Time: 5 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 1 1/2 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings ¼ cup soy sauce 1 lemon, juiced 3 cloves garlic, minced 3 tablespoons minced fresh ginger root 2 teaspoons honey 1 teaspoon prepared Dijon-style mustard ground black pepper to taste 1 cup olive oil Directions Whisk soy sauce, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, honey, mustard, and pepper together in a small bowl until thoroughly combined. Add oil in a steady stream, whisking constantly until incorporated into the dressing. Pour into a glass jar and chill until serving. I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 170 Calories 18g Fat 3g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 170 % Daily Value * Total Fat 18g 23% Saturated Fat 3g 13% Sodium 312mg 14% Total Carbohydrate 3g 1% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 1g Protein 1g 1% Vitamin C 7mg 8% Calcium 8mg 1% Iron 0mg 2% Potassium 34mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Japanese-Style Ginger Salad Dressing 01 of 06 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 06 Photo by  Abbie 01/04/2014 This dressing is really good! I did think it needed more sweetener. I added two tsp Truvia but it still wasn't sweet enough for me so I added about 2 more tsp honey. This made it perfect! I also blended the soy sauce, lemon, etc. in the blender then slowly poured in the oil while it was on med. speed. Once it was done I stirred in about two Tbsp sesame seeds. Yummy! 03 of 06 Photo by  FitHealthy Mom 04/06/2009 Fabulous! I loved this salad dressing, it remminds me of my favorite japanese restaurant. I added extra ginger because I like extra spicy. I also added 1 Tbsp of rice wine vinegar as suggested by one of the reviewers. 04 of 06 Photo by  ONIOND 02/26/2009 Mmm I really enjoyed this recipe. I used a combo of sesame and olive oil, based on the reviews. I think next time I will make it a day in advance, which I wasn't able to do this time; the leftovers just get better and better! Also I would like to try grinding up the ginger rather than mincing it, to give it that pasty consistency like Benihana's. All in all a very impressive outcome for not a lot of effort, and makes even a simple salad something special. Thanks for a great recipe! 05 of 06 Photo by  Pris 05/17/2008 1 You’ll Also Love Famous Japanese Restaurant-Style Salad Dressing 390 Ratings Nona's Japanese Ume Dressing 5 Ratings Asian Ginger Dressing 497 Ratings Tangy Ginger Lime Salad Dressing 29 Ratings Carrot Ginger Dressing and Dip 4 Ratings Creamy Soy-Ginger Dressing 40 Ratings Jesse's Ginger Salad Dressing 78 Ratings Japanese Dressing 2 Ratings 10 Ginger Salad Dressing Recipes Creamy Cilantro Salad Dressing 25 Ratings Miso Sesame Dressing 67 Ratings Korean-Style Salad Dressing 8 Ratings Refreshing Lemon-Ginger Dressing 16 Ratings Absolutely Fabulous Greek Salad Dressing 2,081 Ratings Easy Sesame Dressing 25 Ratings Sweet and Sour Dressing 51 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Paula
instructions: Whisk soy sauce, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, honey, mustard, and pepper together in a small bowl until thoroughly combined. Add oil in a steady stream, whisking constantly until incorporated into the dressing. Pour into a glass jar and chill until serving.
